meanings.definition: A device that combines multiple signals into a single signal for transmission.
meanings.sent1: The multiplexor in our office helps send many messages together in one go.
meanings.sent2: The technician installed a multiplexor to merge all the data streams into one.
meanings.sent3: The multiplexor at the concert mixed all the music notes into a single melody.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a multiplexor, blending thoughts seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The multiplexor acted like a traffic cop, directing all the signals into one lane for transmission.

meanings.definition: A device that selects one of several input signals and forwards it to a single output.
meanings.sent1: The multiplexor at the TV station chooses which channel to broadcast.
meanings.sent2: In the control room, the multiplexor switches between different camera feeds.
meanings.sent3: The multiplexor at the party decided which music to play for the guests.
meanings.sent4: His heart was like a multiplexor, filtering emotions to show only one at a time.
meanings.sent5: The multiplexor functioned like a gatekeeper, allowing only one signal to pass through at a time.
